instructionQibla: Keep the device away from objects made of iron or metal for more accuracy.

badResponseException: Oops! Something went wrong with the server's response. Please try again later.
cancelException: Request cancelled. If this was unintentional, please try again.
badCertificateException: Oops! There is an issue with the security certificate. Please contact support for assistance.
unknownErrorException: Oops! An unknown error occurred. Please try again later.

permissionMessageLocation: This app collects location data to determine studies, prayer times, and qibla according to the user's location. The location information is updated only when the app is open.

shareAppDescription: Check out {}, an app that helps you read the Quran and find prayer times. Download it at {}
dynamicColorDescription: Change the color of the app according to the wallpaper. Only works on Android S+

lastReadingReminderModeDescription.auto: Automatically save last reading when exiting the Surah/Juz page
lastReadingReminderModeDescription.warnMe: Save last reading and remind when exiting the Surah/Juz page
lastReadingReminderModeDescription.off: Turn off last reading reminder, last reading will not be saved

lafazdAllahExplanation.content: The rule of tajwid that applies to reading the word Allah. This tajwid rule is called alif lam jalalah and only applies to the word jalalah, or words with the name of Allah.

ghunnahExplanation.content: When meets with **Noon shaddah (نّ)** & or **Meem shaddah (مّ)** s, the shaddah is like letters **W**. But when previous letters is noon sukoon or tanween the tajweed name is Idghaam Ghunna.

idghamBighunnahExplanation.content:
When letters **Noon sukoon (نْ)** or **Tanween ( ٌ ٍ ً  )** meet with one of the 4 letters these (`ي ن م و`). 

*But if letters **Noon sukoon (نْ)** meet with **Wau (ﻭ)** or **Ya (ﻱ)** is connected without spaces then the tajweed name is not Idghaam Ghunna, but the tajweed name is **Izhaar Mandatory**, check Surah Al-Baqara ayah 86 in `dun-yaa`.*

idghamBilaGhunnahExplanation.content: When letters **Noon sukoon (نْ)** or **Tanween ( ٌ ٍ ً  )** meet with one of letters **Lam (ﻝ)** or **Ra (ﺭ)**.

idghamMimiExplanation.content: When letters **Meem sukoon (مْ)** meet with letters **Meem (ﻡ)**.

iqlabExplanation.content: When letters **Noon sukoon (نْ)** or **Tanween ( ٌ ٍ ً  )** meet with letters **Ba (ﺏ)**. Some of Mushaf there was a small meem standing between them, but there were also Mushaf who did not write small meem standing between them.

ikhfaExplanation.content: When letters **Noon sukoon (نْ)** or **Tanween ( ٌ ٍ ً  )** meet with one of the 15 letters these: `ت ث ج د ذ ز س ش ص ض ط ظ ف ق ك`.

izharExplanation.content:
When the letter **Noon sukoon (نْ)** or **Tanween ( ٌ ٍ ً  )** meets one of the following 7 letters: `أ ه ع ح غ خ`.

The rule for Izhar is to clearly pronounce the silent Nun or Tanwin without nasalization and without holding before pronouncing the `Izhar` letter that follows.

ikhfaSyafawiExplanation.content: When letters **Meem sukoon (مْ)** meet with letters **Ba (ﺏ)**.

qalqalahExplanation.content: When one of the 5 letters these (`ب د ج ط ق`) sukoon in the middle of the sentence, then this is called Qalgala Sughra. And when one of the letters is stopped because of waqf or at the end of the ayah is called Qalgala Kubra, in the Qalqala Kubra if the waqf is not stopped the reciting is not with Qalqala.

calibrationCompass: Please calibrate your compass before use by moving your phone in a figure 8 motion
